meanings.definition: Waste time by loitering or delaying.
meanings.sent1: Don't dillydally on your way to school.
meanings.sent2: Please don't dillydally when we have important tasks to complete.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to dillydally around the garden, chasing butterflies.
meanings.sent4: If you dillydally too much, you might miss the opportunity.
meanings.sent5: She always dillydallies in the morning, making us late for work.

meanings.sent1: Let's not dillydally and finish our homework quickly.
meanings.sent2: He tends to dillydally when it comes to making decisions.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel loves to dillydally before gathering nuts for winter.
meanings.sent4: If you dillydally too long, you might not meet the deadline.
meanings.sent5: Don't dillydally with your dreams; take action and make them a reality.
